abstract: EMI is said to have discussed proposals to sell unprotected files through an array of digital retailers, including Apple, Microsoft, Real Networks and Yahoo.
snippet: EMI is said to have discussed proposals to sell unprotected files through an array of digital retailers, including Apple, Microsoft, Real Networks and Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: The EMI Group, the British music giant, has been considering a plan to offer a broad swath of its recordings for sale online without anti-copying software, executives involved in discussions with the company said.

headline.main: EMI May Sell Recordings Online With No Anti-Copying Software
headline.print_headline: EMI May Sell Recordings Online With No Anti-Copying Software
